newsitem.title: JAPAN: US Treasuries little changed in Tokyo before FOMC.
newsitem.headline: US Treasuries little changed in Tokyo before FOMC.

text.p: U.S. Treasury prices were little changed at the Tokyo midday on Tuesday as a wait-and-see mood prevailed ahead of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting later in the day, traders said.
The dollar's sharp decline versus the yen this morning had no major impact on Treasury prices so far, while market sentiment remained mixed, they said.

"Despite the dollar's fall below 114 yen this morning, prices were generally steady. Operators were unwilling to take fresh positions until they see the Fed's decision on interest rates," a Japanese commercial bank trader said.
The key 6-5/8 percent 30-year bond was unchanged from the New York close at 96-9/32, yielding 6.92 percent. Other prices also stuck near the previous closing levels.
The June T-bond futures contract fell 1/32 from the previous close to 109-28/32.
Traders said the market was split as to whether the Federal Reserve would tighten its federal funds rate further from the current 5.50 percnet.
"There is a 50/50 chance that the Fed will raise the federal funds rate, but there is also growing speculation that it will keep the rate unchanged," another trader said.
